title: 40 fps with gtx 1060...
body:
hi guys I need your help! I got a gtx 1060 3g and have a problem with Lol. I can play the witcher 3, Mordors shadow and dark souls 3 on very high... The only game I cant play is league of legends. I have between 30 and 50fps all the time (even on low!!!). I dont know what to do, maybe u guys have an answer how to solve this problem.


Pc information:

Geforce GTX 1060 3gb
AMD FX-8370E Eight core
16 GB RAM
1920 x 1080 144hz

TY for your help! :)

replies.body: Try to change power plan to "High Performance". It helped for me {{summoner:4}}

Hi Guys, 

i could solve the problem together with the Riot Support. First you have to disable the DVR feature as Targons Blade told. Afterwards you have to change some video settings ingame. Instead of "Full Picture" you have to take "Borderless" in the window mode. I am not sure whether this is the right description because I am not the best english speaker :D  but i hope you know what i mean. Now i have about 200 FPS and I think this is okay for a GTX 1060...

ty for your help, but the problem is still there :I 
maybe I talk with the support >.>

Might be G-Sync. That was causing my drops to about the same fps range and seemingly agnostic of min vs max settings.
Credit to Targon for gettin' mine working. If it's not G-Sync, definitely keep chattin' with him.
Where can i disable this? I am having about 180 FPS constantly in the game, is this ok for a GTX 1060 or should it be better?

Graphics card control panel. Right click your desktop -> NVIDIA Control Panel -> Display -> G-SYNC

I'm on a laptop variant of the 980 getting 250+ so... *shrug*

This is likely caused by a Windows 10 update that enabled the *Game DVR* feature inside the Windows Game Bar. I'd strongly recommend going through [**this guide**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to ensure those features are completely disabled.

Please let me know if this resolved your issue.

Hi Targons Blade, 

i did the steps in the guide you linked. It is a bit better. I have now about 75FPS but it still drops sometimes to 40 drops, but it is better. I looked some youtube videos and i saw that i should have about 200-300 fps so it seems that there is still a problem. Do you have any other idea? 

What i tried is to uninstall the actual graphics driver for gtx1060 and just let Windows10 install the driver. With this graphic driver i have FPS betwenn 300 and 400. With this high fps it is hard lagging but when i limit it to 80 or 120 FPS it is really stable without lags. Maybe there is some problem with the NVIDIA graphics driver? 

I would be so thankful when you can help me. It is my new notebook and its sad that lol isnt working like it should. With ARK (really a challenge for graphic) i have absolutely no problem, so I don't know why LOL makes such problems..

Thank you for your help :)
Hmm.. What happens if you hop back into your **VIDEO** settings in-game and enable *Vertical Sync* and limit your FPS to 120? Let me know if this provided more stability for you.
For me the problem solved with the change of power plan on computer.. Go to Control Panel-->Hardware and Sound-->Power Options and switch it to High Performance...
Ty for your answer, but the problem is still there... at the beginning of the game I have 100-120 fps later on its on 40 to 50...
Do you still have the problem? If not, please help me!

Hi Guys,

Same issue here ... I probably read 30+ topics all across the web to find a solution... nothing worked : im on a laptop, power settings to max perf, V sync turned off, the proper 1060 selected and not the integrated one in the Nvidia control panel, playing on borderless full screen, DVR and all xbox cancer thing turned off. Did i forget something ?
So I reinstalled everything (windows, lol, did all the different solution again.. .and same thing...)

Hey guys, i have exactly the same problem. I can run Ark in epic quality, it is really insane. But with league of legends i have problems. I will go through this guide and let you know whether it worked.
